_header: Though thou be king of tower and town
Note: Stanza 4 is almost identical with stanza 1 of 3344.
_description: Verses urging Man to make Amends — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘But if þou wylt amendis make’ and burden: ‘Synful man for godis sake / I rede þat þou amendis make’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Thow þou byst kyng & wer þe crowne Thow þou byst
                    lord of towr & towne …
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…but ȝyf þou wylt a mendes maksynful man for crystes
                    sake
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 44-5.

BLSl2593.First Lines:
Thow þou be kyng of tour & townThow þou be kyng &
                    were coroun…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…In helle þou xalt ben hangyd hyeBut if þou wilt
                    amendes make
